No point earned if incorrect ΔSo sign is obtained from the presumed value of ΔGo

3 moles of gaseous particles are converted to 2 moles of solid/liquid

title: Part A (ii)
stimulusHtml:
1 point is earned for identifying ΔHo as the principal driving force for the reaction

1 point earned for correct justification

ΔHo drives the reaction.

The decrease in entropy ( ΔSo < 0) cannot drive the reaction, so the decrease in enthalpy

( ΔHo < 0) MUST drive the reaction.

OR

ΔGo = ΔHo - TΔSo; for a spontaneous reaction ΔGo < 0, and a negative value of ΔSo causes

a positive ΔGo.

title: A (iii)
stimulusHtml:
1 point earned for the description of the effect of an increase in temperature on ΔSo and

consequently on ΔGo

No point earned for an argument based on Le Chatelier's principle

Given that ΔGo = ΔHo - TΔSo and ΔSo < 0, an increase in temperature causes an increase in

the value of ΔGo ( ΔGo becomes less negative).

title: Part B (i)
stimulusHtml:
1 point is earned for linking the rate of the reaction to the activation energy, which may be

explained verbally or shown on a reaction profile diagram

The reaction rate depends on the reaction kinetics, which is determined by the value of the

activation energy, Eact. If the activation energy is large, a reaction that is thermodynamically

spontaneous may proceed very slowly (if at all).

title: Part B (ii)
stimulusHtml:
=1 point earned for indicating no change in the value of ΔGo

1 point earned for indicating (verbally, or with a reaction-profile diagram) that the

catalyst affects the activation energy

The catalyst has no effect on the value of ΔGo .

The catalyst reduces the value of Eact, increasing the rate of reaction, but has no effect on the

values of ΔHo and ΔSo , so it cannot affect the thermodynamics of the reaction.
